description.narrative: 1) With mass registration in 2017/2018 over 9 million citizens will be issued with National Identity Cards by end 2018. Key Outcomes are - 90% of eligible resident Malawians are registered and issued with a national identity card. - increawed capacity of National Registration Bureau to operate and maintain the National ID System - Ministries and public services are increasinbly using national ID for administrative or operational purposes 2) Support to the Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development, and Local Authorities will strengthen systems for decentralisation and improve accountability for public resources. 3) Civil society voice and capacity will be increased to promote greater transparency and accountability in Malawi at national and local level. 4) Malawi Electoral Cycle Support Project: The primary goal of the project is to assist in Malawi’s consensual development of procedural certainty among key electoral stakeholders.
Support for public sector reforms including Public Finance Management; Access to Justice. Support for greater citizen voice and engagement with Government
